Test Name: Aerobic and Anaerobic Bacterial Culture and Susceptibility
Specimen Type: Clinical specimen for aerobic/anaerobic culture (e.g., wound, fluid, tissue)
Purpose: To isolate and identify aerobic and anaerobic bacteria in a specimen and determine their antibiotic susceptibility profile.
Container: Sterile leak-proof container or anaerobic transport device
Equipment: Biological safety cabinet, 35 °C ambient-air incubator, 35 °C anaerobic incubator with anaerobic jars/bags, culture media plates and thioglycollate broth, Gram stain and biochemical test reagents, antimicrobial susceptibility testing materials
